content: Interest rates on ETH in Defi tend to be low, unless it's tokenized version of Eth2 staking. The supply of people wanting interest on ETH tends to be much higher than the people wanting to borrow ETH to short it

author: jgm
content: Issuance is running at somewhere around 450 Ether per day, and a single slashed validator loses around 1.5 Ether over its slashing period, so not really.

author: benjaminion
content: On the back of my envelope, I make it about 0.6 ETH total for getting slashed in the current regime: 0.25 initial penalty, and then about 36 days of leakage give another 0.34 ETH. The other correlation slashing penalty should round down to zero as not many validators have been slashed yet.

author: jgm
content: Yeah, Ben is correct.  I was thinking that the initial penalty was still in the 1 Ether range, but it was reduced for the first few months of mainnet.
